meanings.definition: Capable of being deposited as sediment.
meanings.sent1: The sand at the bottom of the river is sedimentable.
meanings.sent2: After the storm, the mud in the puddles became sedimentable.
meanings.sent3: The sedimentable soil made it easy for the plants to grow strong roots.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts settled in her mind like sedimentable particles in water.
meanings.sent5: The sedimentable rocks formed beautiful layers over time.

meanings.sent1: The heavy clay was sedimentable in the water.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the fine particles became sedimentable at the bottom of the lake.
meanings.sent3: The sedimentable dust on the shelves needed to be cleaned regularly.
meanings.sent4: His emotions seemed to be sedimentable, settling deep within him.
meanings.sent5: The sedimentable debris created a layer of silt along the riverbank.
